intro: Dizygotheca plerandroides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has pinnately compound leaves and produces pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and savanna habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
